qas.question: Why is New Mexico always an after thought in American -Spanish speaking society?

answers.text: Because of its relative isolation from other Spanish-speaking areas over most of its 400-year existence

qas.question: Is New Mexico's language different than from other Spanish dialect

answers.text: , New Mexico Spanish, and in particular the Spanish of northern New Mexico and Colorado has retained many elements of 16th- and 17th-century Spanish

qas.question: How does New Mexico's Spanish dialect differ?

answers.text: has developed its own vocabulary. In addition, it contains many words from Nahuatl, the language spoken by the ancient Aztecs of Mexico.

qas.question: Does New Mexico's language also include other dialect?

answers.text: New Mexican Spanish also contains loan words from the Pueblo languages of the upper Rio Grande Valley, Mexican-Spanish words (mexicanismos)

qas.question: Does New Mexico also use language from the  American language when spoken in Spanish?

answers.text: borrowings from English. Grammatical changes include the loss of the second person verb form, changes in verb endings

plausible_answers.text: Because of its relative isolation from other Spanish-speaking areas over most of its 400-year existence
